title: An analysis of the tentative Veigar changes from a Veigar main. Pros and Cons.
body:
So as you may or may not know Veigar was married to DFG, and after its removal he was promised compensation. Today that compensation has been revealed (albeit it isn't on the PBE quite yet) and I have honestly mixed feelings about it.

Summary of changes:
Q, Baleful Strike, is now a **skillshot** but **passes through the first target and hits the second as well.** **Range increased from 
650 to 850**, and **CD is now 1 second lower at earlier ranks and 1 second higher at higher ranks.**

W, Dark Matter, **mana cost reduced to 70/75/80/85/90 from 70/80/90/100/110**. **CD reduced to 10/9.5/9/8.5/8 from 10 at all ranks.**

E, Event Horizon, now has a **0.75 second delay with warning particles before a stun, mana cost reduced to 80/85/90/95/100 from 80/90/100/110/120, Cooldown reduced to 18/17/16/15/14 from 20/19/18/17/16, and range increased to 700 from 650.**

R, Primordial Burst, **AP ratio reduced from 1.2 to 1.0, mana Cost flattened to 125 at all ranks from 125/175/225, and cooldown reduced to 120/100/80 from 130/110/90.**

----
Now let's look at some real pro/con analysis of these changes from a **practical** standpoint.

The changes to Baleful Strike, Q, is a double edged sword.

Pros: Longer range, hits 2 targets, lower early CD.

Cons: Now a skillshot, less reliable, harder to target minions in a cluster, higher late game CD.

Overall whether the changes to Q are a buff or a nerf depends on the projectiles speed. On one hand the range allows for safer farming and harass, but the skillshot element makes it infinitely less reliable.

----

The changes to Dark Matter, W, are a straight-up buff.

Pros: Slightly reduced mana cost, and lower late game cooldowns.

Cons: None really.

----

**The changes to E, Event Horizon, are potentially disastrous to Veigar, and could render him and all other buffs useless. This is what has most Veigar players in a tizzy.** I beg Riot to reconsider these changes.

Pros: Slightly reduced mana cost, slightly reduced CD, and 50 more range.

Cons: **0.75 second delay on his stun WITH warning particles!**

Ho-ly-fuck. What was Riot thinking? I understand that an instant stun is considered bs by a lot of people, but if it were really as omnipotently powerful as people say then Veigar would be a steady pick for ranked and LCS, which he definitely ISN'T. The delay WITH WARNING PARTICLES will likely singlehandedly "olaf" Veigar. In the league of mobility 0.75 seconds is a lot of time to leap away, which leaves Veigar defenseless. Not to mention he now has 0 chance to stun the likes of LeBlanc, Kassadin, or Zed who all live in his lane and teleport everywhere. Veigar already struggled with people like that, now he has almost no hope of defeating them. 

Don't touch the stun Riot. Just, DON'T.

----

The changes to Primordial burst, R, are.. uhm... not good either.

Pros: Mana cost flattened, Cooldown reduced by 10 seconds.

Cons: AP ratio took a huge hit.

So Riot decided to buff Veigar for removing an item that made him deal 20% more damage by REMOVING another 20% of his R ratio??! What. The. Hell. The cooldown is negligible seeing as most people build at least 1 Morellonomicon on him anyway, and while the flattened mana cost is nice the damage reduction is awful, especially with non-ap mids like Zed in play.

----

Overall I don't think this is a buff to Veigar. I think it's actually a slight nerf, which after the removal of DFG is a death sentence.

Now how could Riot go about this differently? 

1) Revert the ratio on R back to what it was, give him some extra range on it.

2) Get rid of that god awful 0.75 second delay on his stun, *maybe* reduce it to 0.5 seconds IF you disable warning particles and give him some extra base damage somewhere.

3) Give his Q the Ahri treatment, Veigar is an immobile mage and that's a huge disadvantage so give him increased movement speed while Q is launched.

People who don't play Veigar don't realize how massive the nerfs to R and E are. They make it so that the rest of his kit may as well not exist.

replies.body:
I never build Deathfires on Veigar and I thought he was just fine.
I personally dont think he needs to be touched.

The way his stun lands most of the time is at max range and the enemy walks into it at the very last second. Trying to land it directly has been a little awkward because of how thin the stun line is.

I think his new Q is going to make it awkward to last hit because the minion you want to farm with it could end up losing a second minion to a minion or tower.

I dont think Veigar needs to be touched at all.

Veigar never needed changes.
Theres already delays for his E
its called CAST TIME
you mean that .25 second delay before any spell comes out, and that is faster than most human reaction time? you mean that cast delay?
You're forgetting the fact that him walking towards you might as well be shouting, "I'M GOING TO STUN YOU  :D".

Veigars stun isn't the easiest thing to hit for an instant stun since you need to hit the edge and is needed to land his w on anyone that is paying attention. Adding  a delay will make it nearly impossible. A better solution would be to lower the stun time and reduce the delay on w. As for the ult mana cost its still higher than all other ults at this point I believe. A while ago riot was reducing **ALL** ult costs to 100.

That's one of the things I'm sad about with these changes; one of the things that would separate good Veigar's from bad ones was the ability to land that instant stun. It's difficult to say that they should have left if untouched since it *did* lack counter play, but it really feels like punishment for the people who dedicated time to learning Veigar, who isn't exactly the most popular champion in the game.

From a larger gameplay perspective, an immobile, squishy short range mage without reliable CC is practically a death sentence. I want to try him out before saying anything more, though.

> [{quoted}](name=MrBuffington,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EEwN1srh,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-02-14T00:01:13.912+0000)
>
> That's one of the things I'm sad about with these changes; one of the things that would separate good Veigar's from bad ones was the ability to land that instant stun.

And the thing that separated good opponents of Veigar from bad opponents of Veigar was... nothing, because they're both instantly stunned.  That's the definition of no counterplay.

If you really want to call yourself good at Veigar now, you'll have to start landing skillshots on NON stunned targets.

> [{quoted}](name=Partholonian,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EEwN1srh,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2015-02-14T18:25:37.088+0000)
>
> And the thing that separated good opponents of Veigar from bad opponents of Veigar was... nothing, because they're both instantly stunned.  That's the definition of no counterplay.
> 
> If you really want to call yourself good at Veigar now, you'll have to start landing skillshots on NON stunned targets.

He has to land the very edge of his ability to stun you. That means he has a huge area you can stand in and murder him because his **delayed** nuke won't hit you unless you're stunned

Isn't that the definition of counterplay?

It's not **that** hard to cast it with the "edge" right on top of an enemy champion.  Against melee champions he can also drop it defensively so they can't gapclose on him (unless they are Fizz or burn Flash), which is incredibly frustrating to play against; now the opponent has a chance to react before the wall goes up.

His whole kit right now is super-binary and has very little counterplay beyond "buy a Banshee's Veil or QSS and only fight him when it's up".  If he lands the stun you're eating a W->Q->R combo for sure.

Is this going to "olaf" him?  I don't know.  But to give him more power his kit really needs to change, because with higher damage numbers he'd be broken right now.

Why is a binary, simple kit bad? Furthermore, why is giving every character extra range for skillshots **good?**

Not all counterplay needs to be "dodge the slow-moving/delayed skillshot," but that's the only form Riot's implemented for ages. You can bait his stun pretty hard; and when it's down he's all but fucked, especially if he missed. Now he's gone from a niche counter to mobility to getting bent over by anyone with a dash. How's that fun for Veigar?

Riot says they want to keep his identity as a burst mage, but these changes are just going to force him to fish for damage with Q pokes from until he gets you low enough to kill you or has enough AP that it doesn't matter. 

But the part that stings most is the fact that the rest of his kit wasn't updated to make up for his core gameplay essentially being taken from him. W is still obnoxiously sluggish, despite its only reliable set-up being made slower, his R *lost* damage, and his Q's been given a longer late game cooldown which just seems unnecessary.

>Why is a binary, simple kit bad?

In this case it makes it extremely difficult to balance Veigar.

When W->Q->R doesn't deal enough damage to kill you, or you have a Banshee's/QSS and can thus evade most of the damage, **Veigar is helpless against you**.  (At least 1v1)

When he's able to stun and 100-0 you (or maybe poke you with Q a couple times and then burst you down) with E->W->Q->R, **you are helpless against him**.  Most melee champs can't touch him while his E is off cooldown unless they blow Flash.

>But the part that stings most is the fact that the rest of his kit wasn't updated to make up for his core gameplay essentially being taken from him. W is still obnoxiously sluggish, despite its only reliable set-up being made slower, his R lost damage, and his Q's been given a longer late game cooldown which just seems unnecessary.

With the change to Q he can -- at least in theory -- get **way** more stacks over time.

I don't know if that's enough to compensate for the other changes, but they could not just raise his AP ratios and leave the rest of his kit as-is.  He'd be broken.

He's one of the few champions with a cohesive kit that's designed around its delicate balance, and I'd rather not see him end up being better played for siege with nuclear Q's and *maybe* a lucky stun.

Generally agree--Caveat, I don't like the q changes, as they mess with his identity somewhat of a "reliable burst mage, at the penalty of mobility" and I feel like just giving a mana refund on last hit like annie would be fine.  If you're gonna do this to veigar, do it to annie too.

You understand that there is literally no counter-play to veigar's stun in it's current iteration, right?

I'll agree the hits to his ult are a bit pointless, especially with the removal of DFG but the stun changes are to give counter-play to a skill that has none; veigar's stun may as well be point and click currently, you cannot dodge it against a veigar that knows how to do anything.

You realize counter-play only favors the mobile champions, right? 

Unless the CC is a suppression (where your teammates can help you out), there's no CC that has counter-play that is equally likely to hit a mobile champion as an immobile one.

With how many mobile champions there are in the game, we need abilities without counter-play. They are a necessary evil.
There are point and click stuns with counterplay. The counterplay is lost when they are immediately followed up by massive burst.

True, but it doesn't change the fact that there needs to be more counterplay OTHER THAN movement.  That's the real league of mobility problem -- too many abilities have the SAME counterplay, so having an ability that's good against "move out of bad stuff" mechanics is way more valuable than almost anything else you can have in your kit.

That's why I suggested making it a 0.5 second delay without warning particles, instead of an instant stun.

And there is counterplay. Tenacity, banshee's, QSS, Morgana shield, etc.
revert the Q change, revert the ult nerf and revert the delay from E

I'd personally be okay with the cage delay (it's the same activation delay as Thresh ult), but there needs to be something about how the theme has been changed. Veigar is twisting the fabric of space to make this cage; you'd think you wouldn't be able to just blink out of it. Basically I like the thematic approach with the 'you're trapped' cage but they need to make it a 'YOU'RE FRIKIN TRAPPED M8, BLOW YOUR FLASH OR STAY IN THERE' kinda thing.

The big difference is that Thresh has not one, but two ways of ensuring his foes stay inside the cage. Thresh doesn't need the cage for follow up either, it is its own utility and damage. Veigar can't land a W without his E. He has no way to hold someone down or keep them there while it activates.

-------

I do agree that the cage should feel like a cage, rather than a "lol whatever, I'll blink out and kill you now". I would love to see it have some sort of "no-dash-zone" effect, where you can't blink or dash out. Shorten the duration as needed, but that's the kind of ability that League of Mobility needs.
They should make it where if you use your W inside your E, after the W delay, it deals damage to anything inside or on the edge of the E. Basically increasing the size of W when used with E.
